ETA.description: Estimated time of arrival at destination

IMO-number.description: IMO ship identification number: a seven digit number that remains unchanged upon transfer of the ship's registration to another country

MMSI.description: Vessel Maritime Maritime Mobile Service Identity (MMSI): a unique nine digit identification number.

call-sign.description: International radio call-sign, up to 7 characters.

course-over-ground.description: The course of the vessel, relative to true north to 0.1 degree

destination.description: Destination of the vessel in max 20 characters

dimension-a.description: Distance in meters from Forward Perpendicular (FP)

dimension-b.description: Distance in meters from After Perpendicular (AP)

dimension-c.description: Distance in meters inboard from port side

dimension-d.description: Distance in meters inboard from starboard side

first-seen.description: When the location was seen for the first time.

last-seen.description: When the location was seen for the last time.

latitude.description: The latitude is the decimal value of the latitude in the World Geodetic System 84 (WGS84) reference.

longitude.description: The longitude is the decimal value of the longitude in the World Geodetic System 84 (WGS84) reference

name.description: 20 characters to represent the name of the vessel

navigational-status.description: 1. at anchor, 2. under command, 3. Restricted Manoeuvrability, etc.

rate-of-turn.description: right or left, from 0 to 720 degrees per minute

true-heading.description: The true heading of the vessel. 0 to 359 degrees

true-heading-at-own-position.description: The true heading at own position of the vessel. 0 to 359 degrees

description: Automatic Identification System (AIS) is an automatic tracking system that uses transceivers on ships.
name: ais
